result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero appeared by video.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia appeared by video for Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Parties provide an update to the Court regarding the defendant's compliance with programming. Parties request an additional status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero appeared by video.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia appeared by video for Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant is eligible for the Tier 1 offer from the State. Defense counsel requests a status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled to 9/6/22 at 8:30 pm. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMG.

Defendant Miguel Angel Montero-Cohetero in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholowe
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 050094,
Payable Number: 1009321,
Receipt Number: 22RP021551,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@2p
